Identity.History: "Nay, the horsemen also are content with a shield and a javelin."\nTacitus, De Origine et situ Germanorum, 98 CE.
Identity.Tooltip: Like a sword, a horse was quite expenive and as a result cavalry was relatively rare. Nevertheless, the Germanic horsemanship had a high level as evidenced by the Romans who used Germanic soldiers in many of their elite cavalry forces.
